text: What is the primary purpose of mass communication?
correctAnswer: To reach a large audience

text: Which of the following is considered traditional media?
correctAnswer: Newspapers

text: What does the term 'media convergence' refer to?
options: The merging of different media platforms
correctAnswer: The merging of different media platforms

text: Which theory suggests that media shapes how we perceive the world?
correctAnswer: Agenda-Setting Theory

text: What is the primary role of a journalist?
options: To report and analyze current events
correctAnswer: To report and analyze current events

text: What does 'broadcasting' refer to in media?
options: Distributing content to a broad audience via television or radio
Uploading videos to a private channel
correctAnswer: Distributing content to a broad audience via television or radio

text: What is the purpose of public relations (PR)?
options: To manage the reputation of an individual or organization
correctAnswer: To manage the reputation of an individual or organization

text: What is 'media literacy'?
options: The ability to critically analyze and interpret media content
The ability to create media content
The technical skill to use cameras
correctAnswer: The ability to critically analyze and interpret media content

text: What does the term 'target audience' mean?
options: A specific group of people a message is aimed at
The largest group reached by a message
A random group selected for research
The people who reject media messages
correctAnswer: A specific group of people a message is aimed at

text: Which of the following is an example of new media?
correctAnswer: Podcasts

text: What does 'fake news' refer to?
options: Deliberately false information presented as news
News that is difficult to understand
Old news that is no longer relevant
correctAnswer: Deliberately false information presented as news

text: What is the primary goal of advertising?
options: To persuade audiences to purchase a product or service
To educate the public about global issues
correctAnswer: To persuade audiences to purchase a product or service

text: What is the difference between interpersonal and mass communication?
options: Interpersonal is one-on-one, while mass is one-to-many
Interpersonal uses technology, while mass does not
Interpersonal is always private, while mass is public
correctAnswer: Interpersonal is one-on-one, while mass is one-to-many

text: What does the term 'bias in media' mean?
options: A preference or prejudice in presenting news
The use of technical jargon in reports
correctAnswer: A preference or prejudice in presenting news

text: What is the role of a content creator?
options: To produce original material for online platforms
correctAnswer: To produce original material for online platforms

text: What does 'viral content' refer to?
correctAnswer: Content that spreads rapidly online

text: What is a documentary?
options: A factual film about real-life events or subjects
correctAnswer: A factual film about real-life events or subjects

text: What is the term for the first draft of a news story?
correctAnswer: Copy

text: Which of the following is an example of visual communication?
correctAnswer: Infographics

text: What is a podcast?
options: An audio program available on-demand online
correctAnswer: An audio program available on-demand online

text: Which of the following is an ethical concern in media?
correctAnswer: Plagiarism

text: What is a press release?
options: A statement issued to the media by an organization
correctAnswer: A statement issued to the media by an organization

text: Which of the following best defines a 'media campaign'?
options: A series of coordinated efforts to communicate a message
A single article published in a magazine
A viral post on social media
correctAnswer: A series of coordinated efforts to communicate a message

text: What does 'SEO' stand for in digital communication?
correctAnswer: Search Engine Optimization

text: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of digital media?
correctAnswer: Static communication

text: What is the term for unauthorized use of copyrighted material in media?
correctAnswer: Copyright infringement

text: What is the role of a producer in media production?
options: Overseeing the production process and managing resources
Acting in front of the camera
correctAnswer: Overseeing the production process and managing resources

text: What does 'citizen journalism' refer to?
options: A specific type of newspaper reporting
correctAnswer: News reported by ordinary individuals

text: What is an editorial in journalism?
options: An opinion piece written by the publication's editors
A report on a specific event
A headline of a news story
correctAnswer: An opinion piece written by the publication's editors

text: What is the term for a journalist's collection of their published work?
correctAnswer: Portfolio
